body:
Sorry, reverted it since it breaks other builds.

You are right that GitHub PR is not yet working in Ratis.
Needs another update to avoid `CLOSING -> RUNNING`, too.
The third commit fixes `CLOSING/CLOSED -> STARTING/RUNNING` illegal transitions.
@szetszwo @bshashikant please review when you have some time
@adoroszlai , please post the patch in the JIRA.  Jenkins is not yet working with Ratis.
Closed by c0721c1fe6ba1dc19e8d8bb8bb3c13382c945704.
Thanks @arp7 for the review. I will merge it shortly.
Thanks @arp7  for the review. I've merged the change to master. Will open separate JIRAs to fix the ratis jenkins issue which have been broken for a while.
Already merged.
@mukul1987 Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.
@bshashikant Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.

Thanks @runzhiwang . PR model doesn't yet work seamlessly in RATiS. Can you update the patch
on the jira itself?
@bshashikant Yes, I have updated the patch on the jira.
@elek why this merge request hasn't merged yet? does it have any problem?

> @elek why this merge request hasn't merged yet? does it have any problem?

Because the Easter Holidays in Europe ;-) I am checking it right now, apologize for the delay...
Sorry, I think there is a problem related to this PR
I think you close this PR instead of merging it.

I merge the commits locally because I prefer to sign the commits (which is not possible with the merge buttons). To have a reference between the PR I added an additional text to the commit message ("Closes #843") which closes the the PR automatically when I push the commit to the master.

If you click to the  2c8d550  commit from the previous message you can see that it's on the master.
 
This can be confusing, but the commits are signed ;-)

(The same are explained here: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/HADOOP/Using+Github+for+Ozone+development)

But I can make mistakes easily (usually I do), so feel free to ping me if the commit is missing from the master. In this case seems to be there.

Example build looks good:

https://github.com/elek/incubator-ratis/runs/605489686?check_suite_focus=true
Sorry for the noise. We had some issue with the pr build. I added the missing commits as an addendum to RATIS-697.
Merged. Thanks the contribution @mukul1987
looks good with some minor comments.
@bshashikant I dont see the comments.
@bshashikant Thanks for the review! I have merged the PR to master branch.
@lokeshj1703 Thanks for your review. I have updated the patch.

@runzhiwang Thanks for the contribution! @bshashikant Thanks for the review! I have committed the PR to master branch. 
Made a minor change in the commit made to master: Removed @VisibleForTesting annotation on RaftServerImpl@isLeaderReady.
@mukul1987 Thanks for the contribution! I have committed the PR to master branch.

@szetszwo @lokeshj1703 @bshashikant 
I think this patch does not generate new failed UT.
I trigger CI several times, all the [failed UT](https://github.com/runzhiwang/incubator-ratis/runs/628048866) are in the list of [RATIS-863](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/RATIS-863).  I together with @bshashikant summary all the failed UT generated by ratis/master in RATIS-863.

Besides, the failed UT in this PR has nothing to do with this patch. You can find the reason in [RATIS-912](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/RATIS-912)

I delete the following assert, because when we restart new LogAppender, the old LogAppender maybe still alive, because we do not wait old LogAppender turn dead before start new LogAppender.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51938049/80561786-31593700-8a18-11ea-980a-3bbdc8433680.png)
Let's wait for @szetszwo to take a look before committing.
+1 the change looks good.
@runzhiwang We don't see this failure in latest runs? Do you think this was fixed by RATIS-881?

@lokeshj1703  It can not be fixed by RATIS-881, it was caused by UT and Ratis Use different threads, and can not reproduce every time. And I test it again, it still happen.  To easy reproduce, you can add Thead.sleep(1000) between statement 1 and statement 2 to delay the timerContext.stop(), it will happen.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51938049/80600346-d7c82b00-8a5e-11ea-86ae-0f713b5bb288.png)
@hmcl , can you please clarify why this patch is required?
Thanks @bshashikant for reviewing and merging this.
@avijayanhwx, can you plz look at this ?
LGTM. +1
@runzhiwang  Thanks for the contribution! I have merged the PR to master branch.
cc @elek since he added the reporter registrations.
Thanks for addressing comments. I am +1 for the patch.
Thanks @runzhiwang for the review, and @bshashikant for reviewing and committing this.

Thanks @runzhiwang for working on this. We can potentially large no of closed segments in ratis pipeline lifecycle if log purging is not enabled. I am just thinking if it would be better to maintain the total segment size in memory instead of iterating over all to figure the size every-time to fetch the metric value. What do you think?
LGTM. +1
Thanks @runzhiwang for reviewing and @adoroszlai for working on it.
Thanks @runzhiwang for the review and @bshashikant for reviewing and merging it.

Fixed checkstyle and one unit test - TestSegmentedRaftLog.
Other failing unit tests pass locally.
Failing unit tests pass locally.
Thank you @lokeshj1703 for the review. I addressed all your comments in commit [8ea4014](https://github.com/apache/incubator-ratis/pull/88/commits/8ea401453866d0d9e5a2b099fc6b8ecd6bdee33a).
Thanks @runzhiwang. I am +1 for this patch.

You can open a  jira at https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/RATIS/issues, and add the jira number in the Pull Request title. 
Besides, the Pull Request title is also too long.
@lokeshj1703 Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.

@runzhiwang Thanks for working on this! I think this scenario will occur when client cancels the call. How about we extract the status in onError(using Status.fromThrowable(Throwable)) and check if it is cancelled. If it is cancelled we do not make the onCompleted call. Let's see if that solves the problem.
@lokeshj1703  Thanks for review. The suggestion does work. I have updated.
@mukul1987 Thanks for the clarification! I'm +1 on the PR.
@runzhiwang Thanks for the contribution! I have committed the PR to master branch.
@mukul1987 the hadoop tests are failing with the PR. It might be related to the ProtobufRpcEngineShaded file. By default hadoop tests are disabled so failure did not show up in unit tests.
+1 the change looks good.
Thanks @lokeshj1703 for the reviews. Merged into master.
@lokeshj1703 Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.
@mukul1987 We can fix the tests as part of separate jira. +1 for the PR.
@mukul1987 Thanks for the review! I have committed the PR to master branch.

@bshashikant @avijayanhwx Could you help review this patch ?
I think `GrpcServerMetrics `and `LogServiceMetricsRegistry `should extend `RatisMetrics`, then we do not need to define `register `and `unregister `in `GrpcServerMetrics `and `LogServiceMetricsRegistry`. If you agree, I will open another PR to refactor code.

> @bshashikant @avijayanhwx Could you help review this patch ?
> I think `GrpcServerMetrics `and `LogServiceMetricsRegistry `should extend `RatisMetrics`, then we do not need to define `register `and `unregister `in `GrpcServerMetrics `and `LogServiceMetricsRegistry`. If you agree, I will open another PR to refactor code.

I agree. We should to this refactoring. Any reason why we cannot do it in this PR, given we are fixing the problem with those 2 metric classes?

> Any reason why we cannot do it in this PR, given we are fixing the problem with those 2 metric classes

@avijayanhwx Thanks for review. Yeah, I will do it in this PR.
@avijayanhwx  I have refactored the code.  Could you help review it again ?
Thanks @lokeshj1703 for the reviews and comments. Fixed the missing %d. Will merge after CI runs.
Thank you @lokeshj1703 for the reviews. Failing unit tests are unrelated and pass locally. Merging this PR.
Any other comment or opionion?
I have improved the PR and addressed all the * imports, current failure in build(unit tests) is not related to my work

> Thanks @runzhiwang. I am +1 for this patch.

My vote is non-binding since I am not a committer. cc @bshashikant.
@lokeshj1703 @bshashikant @mukul1987  Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.
@lokeshj1703 @bshashikant @mukul1987 Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.
Thanks @bshashikant for reviewing and committing it.
@bshashikant @lokeshj1703 Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.
@mukul1987 - Request your review.
@runzhiwang Thanks for the contribution! I have committed the PR to master branch.
Thank you for the patch @runzhiwang . LGTM +1 (non-binding)
@adoroszlai  thanks for the review, addressed review comments in recent commit
@bshashikant @lokeshj1703 Could you help review it ? Thank you very much.
@mukul1987 can you please take a look. Thanks.
Failures unrelated to patch
@bshashikant @lokeshj1703 Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.

@elek Could I request your quick review as you had done the similar changes in Ozone?
Unlike your changes in Ozone, I am performing the sonar check first and then the unit tests as Ratis has some broken UTs. Those will ensure the unit check part exits out once it fails the unit tests and may not trigger the sonar check.

Checkstyle failure is unrelated to the PR.

ratis-server/src/main/java/org/apache/ratis/server/raftlog/segmented/LogSegment.java
 47: Unused import - org.apache.ratis.server.raftlog.RaftLog.INVALID_LOG_INDEX.
@bshashikant @lokeshj1703 Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.
@bshashikant @lokeshj1703 Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.
@bshashikant @lokeshj1703 Could you help review this patch ? Thank you very much.
@dineshchitlangia Thanks for you review.
Thanks @mukul1987 for review & commit.

@elek Thank you for the review. You are right the Github token is not needed when merging/pushing locally. As we are slowly moving towards merging directly via GitHub PRs this will be needed, at least as per Sonar's documentation :)

Let me know if you can commit this or you want me to drop the github token.

> this will be needed, at least as per Sonar's documentation :)

Ok, thanks. Good to know. In that case, let me merge it.

Thanks @elek  for review/commit.
Thanks @mukul1987  for reviews.

I confirmed we are able to see the Sonar analyses : https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=apache_incubator-ratis

I will create an action plan / umbrella Jira to fix all of these and we should be in a clean state soon.

> I confirmed we are able to see the Sonar analyses : https://sonarcloud.io/dashboard?id=apache_incubator-ratis

Wow. Great work.
cc @dineshchitlangia
Thanks @bshashikant for review/commit.
cc @bshashikant  / @lokeshj1703
@mukul1987 can you please take a look when you get a chance. Thanks.
Thanks @runzhiwang for working on this and @avijayanhwx for the review. I have committed this.
@runzhiwang , can you please update the PR?
